intro: Lucuma krukovii, commonly known as the golden fruit tree, is a species native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and distinctive, orange-colored fruit. The fruit is typically harvested when it reaches a mature yellow-orange hue, indicating ripeness. The plant thrives in high-altitude environments with well-drained soil and a temperate climate. Its botanical features make it a unique and valuable species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
